name: Vancouver East Veterinary Walk-In Clinic
address: Vancouver East Veterinary Walk-In Clinic, 3033 Grandview Hwy, Vancouver, BC V5M 2E4

featured_reviews.review_id: Staff are attentive and helpful, grooming service is on point, and very helpful for pets with longer fur and mats.  Only point of contention is that sometimes the veterinary clinic is open for business, but the staff are not present, and only the groomer is on site.  So it makes it difficult to pickup meds and prescriptions for your animal.  Not a consistent  thing to happen, but something to be aware of in case.
featured_reviews.review_text: Staff are attentive and helpful, grooming service is on point, and very helpful for pets with longer fur and mats.  Only point of contention is that sometimes the veterinary clinic is open for business, but the staff are not present, and only the groomer is on site.  So it makes it difficult to pickup meds and prescriptions for your animal.  Not a consistent  thing to happen, but something to be aware of in case.

featured_reviews.review_id: This is located inside Tisol (right beside Staples) on Grandview highway. Friendly staff and especially the Veterinarians. Most appointments can be done here. Our dog had surgery at their Arbutus/ 16th location.  Pricing was fair when we compared initially. Don't oversell you.
featured_reviews.review_text: This is located inside Tisol (right beside Staples) on Grandview highway. Friendly staff and especially the Veterinarians. Most appointments can be done here. Our dog had surgery at their Arbutus/ 16th location.  Pricing was fair when we compared initially. Don't oversell you.

featured_reviews.review_id: The vet and all the staff here are so kind and super helpful and their pricing is very reasonable. We had a bad experience previously at hemlock animal hospital and were left very much in the dark about my senior cats kidney disease diagnosis. The vet here at Vancouver east took the extra time to sit with me and explain everything in detail and come up with a treatment plan, and explain what our options will be in the future when her condition worsens. I'm so thankful we brought her here and got a second opinion. They will be our regular vet going forward with all pets, present and future.

featured_reviews.review_id: Although have a very good vet (Dr Shura) who we've been happy with the past 2 years, the limited & confused operating hours at this place keeps getting worse, while prices keep going up. Their Google maps opening hours here clearly show open on Saturdays, yet we came today from the other side of town to pick up medication, and the clinic has a sign inexplicably saying 'CLOSED'. We received a phone message from them last week saying our medication was ready to be picked up, but now when we phoned to check where it is, they told us there is no record of it in their system. Very disappointing. Would no longer recommend this place.

featured_reviews.review_id: Excellent clinic. The entire staff if friendly and professional. We go to Dr. Shura and could not recommend him enough. He is super calming and friendly to our dog and is very approachable to us. Always making sure we have time for questions. They give us the feeling that they are always covering all bases and check ups are thorough. We got our dog neutered there and all went great.
featured_reviews.review_text: Excellent clinic. The entire staff if friendly and professional. We go to Dr. Shura and could not recommend him enough. He is super calming and friendly to our dog and is very approachable to us. Always making sure we have time for questions. They give us the feeling that they are always covering all bases and check ups are thorough. We got our dog neutered there and all went great.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Yael! We're so glad you're enjoying your experiences with us.

featured_reviews.review_id: We had the pleasure of dealing with Dr. Kevin Shura at the clinic. He was a real treat in what was a stressful situation. He treated the symptoms as presented and was honest and upfront about associated costs and his recommendations. All the office staff were pleasant and friendly - having a sick pet can be a bit stressful and they made us feel comfortable. Their rates are fair and the service is extraordinary - while the limited hours might be a bit inconvenient  if it isn't an emergency situation it is worth the wait to take your furry friends there!

featured_reviews.review_id: Located inside the pet store, friendly animal loving staff and thorough pet doctors. Introduction of my pup to the vet was loaded with treats to ensure a good experience for the pup. The vet I spoke with was very informative and listened to my every concern, also gave me a earful of recommendations for a healthy pup. Very satisfied.
featured_reviews.review_text: Located inside the pet store, friendly animal loving staff and thorough pet doctors. Introduction of my pup to the vet was loaded with treats to ensure a good experience for the pup. The vet I spoke with was very informative and listened to my every concern, also gave me a earful of recommendations for a healthy pup. Very satisfied.
featured_reviews.response_from_owner_text: Thank you Justine! We're so glad to hear you and your pup enjoyed your experience with us. We look forward to seeing you again!

featured_reviews.review_id: We recently moved homes so we had to find a new vet in our area. I saw the reviews for Vancouver East Veterinary Walk-In Clinic so we booked our cat in here. Sadly, this was a huge mistake on our part. We took our cat in for her annual checkup. All of the documents were transferred from our previous vet to this one, so it should have her up to date vaccine information and other health background. Unfortunately, Dr. Shura didn't even pay attention to her vaccination history anyways, and despite our cat having gotten her 3-year vaccines in 2018, he said it was done in 2017 and then vaccinated her anyways. I didn't notice this until I got home and saw my previous invoices from the previous vet that said she last got the vaccination in 2018. A few days after we got home from the vet, my cat's hair started falling out in the area where the vaccination was injected. We tried calling Vancouver East Veterinary Walk-In Clinic on Wednesday at around 10AM and there was no pick-up (they are closed most of the week, open only for limited hours in the afternoon), no voice mail, and no emergency line you can call. We ended up having to drive back to our old vet to get her looked at because that was our only option. I understand that adverse side effect may happen after a vaccination, but I am very disappointed that the vet misread her vaccination history and gave her something she didn't need, and also we weren't able to reach them or an alternate number. When we were getting our cat looked at, Mr. Shura said to us that he doesn't like to overvaccinate animals because he'll get our money through teeth cleanings anyways (he had recommended a teeth cleaning for our cat). I couldn't tell if he was a vet or a used car salesman.
